summary: Jörmungandr is a giant sea serpent in Norse mythology. It's so big that it surrounds the entire Earth and bites its own tail. People often call it the Midgard Serpent. Jörmungandr is the child of the god Loki and the giantess Angrboða. Odin banished it to the ocean, where it grew massive. Thor, the thunder god, is Jörmungandr's archenemy, and they will fight to the death during Ragnarök, the end of the world. This serpent is a powerful symbol, representing an eternal cycle.
title: Jörmungandr
